verses.t: LordThe {H3068} reigneth{H4427}, he is clothed{H3847} with majesty{H1348}; Lordthe {H3068} is clothed{H3847} with strength{H5797}, wherewith he hath girded{H247} himself: the world{H8398} also is stablished{H3559}, that it cannot be moved{H4131}.
Thy throne{H3678} is established{H3559} of old{H227}: thou art from everlasting{H5769}.of old: Heb. from then
The floods{H5104} have lifted up{H5375}, LordO {H3068}, the floods{H5104} have lifted up{H5375} their voice{H6963}; the floods{H5104} lift up{H5375} their waves{H1796}.
LordThe {H3068} on high{H4791} is mightier{H117} than the noise{H6963} of many{H7227} waters{H4325}, yea, than the mighty{H117} waves{H4867} of the sea{H3220}.
Thy testimonies{H5713} are very{H3966} sure{H539}: holiness{H6944} becometh{H4998} thine house{H1004}, LordO {H3068}, for ever{H3117}.for ever: Heb. to length of days
